critique: This document is an executive order from 1942 ordering Organized Reserves into active military service. Given the context of World War II, several axes are affected. Ideologically, it reflects a centrist approach (0) as it's a wartime measure with broad support. Immigration is not relevant (-1). Executive power is expanded (+3) due to the wartime emergency. Federalism is strengthened (+2) as the federal government takes control of state militias. National security is prioritized over civil liberties (+3) due to the draft. Economic regulation is indirectly affected (0) as the military mobilization impacts the economy. Social inclusion is not directly addressed (-1). Revised scores reflect these considerations.
